Reviews.Title: “Dangerous dump”
Reviews.Author: worktolive22
Reviews.Content: First the pros- there are two. 1) Brilliant location if you love Glebe restaurants, cafes and the market on Saturday. 2) the pool is clean and cold. Now the cons- there are MANY. Rooms smell bad, have never been properly cleaned (check the air con vents - yuk), are extremely noisy and have things that don't work - ie. when a DVD plater breaks they don't replace it (neither room we tried had one). After our first noisy night I asked if we could be moved to a quieter room. They lamented that the standard rooms are all in the noisy corner positions but they did have one at the back but no windows or balcony. As sleeping was our priority that night and the room was much cleaner, we took it. After being in the room for a while, we noticed the air con was dripping quite heavily onto the bedside table. i pulled the bedside table forward and found water splashing onto a power point. We turned it off and told the staff on our way out who promised to look into it and swore they hadn't known (even though an unplugged lamp was nearby). When we returned we found that their way of dealing with it was to put a towel under it. Not having the air con on was too stuffy in a room with no windows but being electrocuted in the night would have been worse. This place needs to be closed down.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasany Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gary H
Reviews.Content: The Haven Inn is a medium sized, friendly, and convenient place to stay in Sydney. It has been friendly, tidy and kept in a good state since i have started staying here last century. Public transport by bus or tram to the city is easy and quick. The tarriffs are reasonable, staff are friendly and attentive, the pool always looks inviting. The charachter in Glebe is good, has a pleaseant community feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing that redeems this hotel - and only just - is its location.”
Reviews.Author: Gianttree
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty dreadful establishment. And although it sits at the budget end of things, it is most definitely over-priced. My so-called superior room smelt musty, had a dusty bare floor, no DVD player (was advertised as having one) and contained the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in. There was no working smoke alarm (illegal?). The location on Glebe Point Road is obviously a big plus, though if you do end up staying here, be sure to bring earplugs as it is a very noisy street. This place really has nothing to recommend it. I would be shopping around for a much better run and maintained 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired, noisy and poorly maintained”
Reviews.Author: ehoogs
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the staff seemed indifferent and were not particularly welcoming. Despite the photos showing a restaurant, there is in fact no restaurant at all - unless they're claiming the cafe across the road as their restaurant.There is no lift so if you're on a higher floor you need to climb the stairs. I travelled in a party of 5 and we had 2 different rooms. One room was at the front of the building and in the 15 years I've travelled around the world, I've never experienced so much noise! A bus goes past every 5 minutes and you could almost touch it out the window! The other room was at the back of the building so definitely quieter. When we opened the door to this room, it stank, it was dark and gloomy and despite knowing there were 3 guests staying, they only provided 2 towels. Both rooms were tired with badly worn decor and would barely pass the cleanliness test. The beds sank in the middle and you could feel the spring in your back and the pillows were terrible. 2 of the 5 pillows I looked at were actually broken inside the cover so it was like sleeping on 2 lumps which were paper thin! It looks like they've recently painted the bathroom doors but they've only had one coat and you can see the roll marks and in many places where the paint has accidently ended up on the ceiling. We paid about $110 per night for each room and stayed for 2 nights. I think that they should be charging backpacker prices of no more than $50 - $60 per room per night - and even then, it needs a good clean. The only thing the place has going for it is it's location. It's on the bus route and only about 5 minutes by bus to the CBD. It also has nice restaurants and cafes nearby. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Worn place and noise from street”
Reviews.Author: SJLU
Reviews.Content: When I got into the hotel the receptionist told me he reserved the best room for us, I understood it's a kind of sales technique, but I'd rather he didn't say that. There's a very bad smell in the room and even with long time ventilation it's hard to get clean of it, all the furnitures with dirty legs, air conditioner is in dark yellow, stains are visible, I think this is the reason why smell came from. The small balcony is just over the pedestrian street, it's full of dust and no interest to stand out for a second.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing waste of money”
Reviews.Author: mary m
Reviews.Content: The Haven Inn was old, dirty and dingy. There is no courtyard breaky.. There is no clean linen. There are hairs on the pillows supplied complimentary. the bathroom comes with mould and scum-and a spa so dirty and stained I wouldn't wash my dog in! Dont do it!!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO THERE!!! BED BUGS!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Richard H
Reviews.Content: Absolutely disgustingly dirty, nothing works properly, rude staff, and riddled with BED BUGS!!!!! The is no doubt that the website is false advertising. I can't believe that this place is even aloud to trade, obviously our regulatory bodies are not doing their job!

Reviews.Title: “No haven at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: Denise N
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read all the reviews of this motel before I booked. I was happy at the time of booking because the motel looked beautiful on the website. What a difference it is in person. We arrived to no underground parking, when we inquired, the "receptionist" came out and grudgingly moved his own motorbike, and then we had to get him to park our car as the parking spaces were so small. When we were told we were on the third floor we took the steps with trepidation due to our first impressions. When we got into the room it was like an oven and smelled. There were tiles missing off the bathroom floor, the smoke alarm was hanging from the roof, the "balcony view" was over a back lane and into a rundown house next doors yard. The stairs down to the pool were filthy with half the roof missing in the stairwell. The cleaners cart was just left at the end of the corridor under the missing roof, god knows what bugs extra would have gotten into it. The pool had tiles missing from around the edge and was fithly and rusted on the sides. The steps and hand rails into the pool were very loose and unstable. There was no restaurant as the website predicted, you were directed over to a cafe across the road where we found out that the owner of the cafe was the owner of the motel. On our second day the air con broke and when we asked about it the reception said there was nothing he could do. We demanded to be moved and was eventually moved into a room smaller (if possible) than the first, thank god it was only for one night. They also claim on their website that movies are free, however they aren't. The whole motel is a disgrace and should be shut down for being filthy, not meeting aus safety standards and unsafe. I would never recommend it to anyone, total disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “a disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: pintsizeuk
Reviews.Content: staff not particularly helpful or friendly. door to our room was left open by the cleaners, staff didnt seem to care when we notified them, offered no apology. room ok but not very well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Will ruin your stay!”
Reviews.Author: Stayedinalotofhotels
Reviews.Content: 3 of us just stayed in two rooms. Couldnt use the shower fist night. Neither safes worked. Rooms were dirty and bed bugs in one room! Sticky and stained carpets and walls. Key card for the room stopped working each day. Web site says there is a restaurant... Nope, were given a voucher for the cafe across the road. If you see the pictures of this place online you will be very disappointed. As always, please make up your own mind. This was just our experience. We would not stay here again. The only positive thing I would say is that the desk staff were nice.

Reviews.Title: “i couldn't even rate this place 1”
Reviews.Author: frequentravellerNz
Reviews.Content: i left my family in the room while i went down stairs to complain and i was worried for thier safety while i was gone. i first said to the arrogant part owner of the place,that they were false advertising - the photos taken by themselves were taken with a fisheye lense which made the rooms look a lot bigger than they really were. we payed for a family room 2 adults and 2 kids and wrongly asumed we would have a bed each - there was a bed leaning up against a wall which made things even more cramped. these rooms certainly have not had any cats swung in them. the cleaners do a great job with what they have to work with but unfortunately they will be out of work soon when this place closes down. i asked to see their best room as i would have payed more and i was shown another rubbish room. they say there is a room with a spa/jacussi - i do not believe them. before you book your holiday from hell in this hovel - check out the other reviews, they are also bad.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the other reviews...”
Reviews.Author: Cate1949
Reviews.Content: We checked in for 2 nights (Mon & Tues) for $120 per night Superior Balcony View room. The room was clean, bathroom had been renovated but tap handle missing, soap dish falling off wall but clean. Has everything you need including the new digital tv. No lift so being on the top floor (3rd) is a bit difficult if you have a lot of luggage. Great views and very handy to lots of restaurants/cafes of any cuisine you like. The Toxteth Hotel opposite was good for dinner and they have a deal with the cafe across the road for breakfast and lunch with 10% discount - great breakfast and a really great coffee. Parking is $15 per day underneath and is limited with very narrow spaces. Plenty of transport options including light rail to get into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go, stay in the city”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl M
Reviews.Content: I booked thinking it would be nice to stay just out of the city, wrong!. The outside of the building looked old and uncared for, didnt worry me, but once inside the reception staff could not have cared less, they were painfully rude It was a Saturday afternoon and they were busy no excuse. Room was upstairs 3 flights, no lift no big deal but would have been nice to know not a word about no lift. The reception staff did not say at the time there were people to help with the cases, found out in the room. The room was OK not recently refurbished as the site said , bathroon nice only. The room had a small balcony overlooking the road and a great veiw of the harbour, the balcony was filthy! the room was OK for cleanliness but only OK, very noisy, the other cliental were also very noisy all night. At 3am the fire alarm went off and kept going off, at no time did management attempt to let the customers know there was no fire, people were waiting, no direction was given at all. I had to ask the fireman and I told the others that there was no fire. For $ 176.00 we stayed at Pier one on the harbour which was fabulous Im sorry I wasted our money on this terrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!”
Reviews.Author: shambles75
Reviews.Content: I will admit that I don't know Sydney at all and when considering accomodation for a weekend the suburb was all I had to go on! Glebe is a beautiful, villiage type suburb and I thought the Haven Inn would match! But NO! It was rather late when we booked it, if it hadn't been I would have gone somewhere else! The rooms are small, outdated and dirty! We had decided to book a room with a spa but i wouldn't recommend spending the extra money! The bathroom was dirty, mouldy, there was no exhaust fan or shower curtain (causing the floor and everything on it to be soaked) and the light above the vanity didn't even work! The TV didn't work, the bed had seen better days, the bed side lamps had no globes and the windows were covered in smears!! The noise from other guests was easily heard and traffic was loud (we were on the 3rd floor though)! The best thing about the room was the fact we had clean glasses! haha and I'm not kidding! I wouldn't recommend it to anyone! Very disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a shock to the system, cheap and almost chearfull.”
Reviews.Author: Sanddancer01
Reviews.Content: W got a bit of a shock when we saw the exterior of this hotel, its seen better days but we were happy enough once we got inside, the room which we booked for 3 adults and one child was a family room, actually two rooms ajoined, the first room had a double bed and a single bed, the second room had two sets of single bunks so in total the room would sleep up to 7 people if needed, we paid $129.00 so cant complain about anything really at that price. The hotel is more like a motel, the room we had was recently refurnished so was presentable enough, the bed was very comfortable and the bedding was clean. A bar fridge and safe was in the room. The train is a short 5 minute walk and takes you into sydney city for $3.40 a ticket, we got a taxi from Darling Harbour back to the hotel for $8.00. The hotel has private parking which is charged at $15.00 a day, there isnt much street parking so its pretty good value. In our room the AC seemed to work but we couldnt get it to blow hot, the room was quite cold through the night, the bedside lamp didnt work and we could only get a good picture on one channel on the tv. All in all for the price we paid, we were happy but it definatly looks better on the web, than it is.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy 'till 4am and ugly all the time. Smokers hanging off the balconies”
Reviews.Author: Millie2251
Reviews.Content: WOW! I expected budget and 'plain simple; accommodation but there are some things you just can't overlook. I especially loved the razor blade disposal unit in the bathroom and bottle opener on the bedroom wall :) lol. The bedroom window did not lock and faced a wall. It didn't actually have a lock on it or a latch and we were on the ground level.There was a piece of wooden dowl instead. There's a safe in the wardrobe for valuables and the bedding was clean and made -up daily. The TV was basic but the batteries from the remote had been (I assume) stolen?!?!? We killed at least three cockroaches. I agree that the photographs are not at all, at all,at all like the actual rooms. Carpet is stale and yuck. I have stayed in budget places and pubs before with shared bathrooms etc...this was sub standard for a family and cramped and noisy and smelly and EXTREMELY UGLY .... makes it depressing in my book :( We made a go of it as it was holiday time ... but seriously stay at home rather than stay here with your family. Pool looked OK but kids say it was freezing. Their Cafe opposite which you get 10% discount at is (quite bizarrely) lovely!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE....GREAT POSITION”
Reviews.Author: elle2461
Reviews.Content: We found the Haven Inn fairly good for the price. The position was very good with a short bus ride to the CBD right outside the accommodation and running frequently. Cafes & resturants are just at you doorstep. Our room was the Superior Balcony with city views. The views were great and we were lucky to see the fireworks at Darling Harbour. There is a lot of street noice, but that is the choice you make to have the views. Our room was fine and clean, considering it is only 3 star. Bathroom was renovated although small. One big turn off, THE LINEN...GET RID OF IT. Update all the bed linen, l asked the linen to be changed, because of some unknown stains. They did, no worries.....with other clean sheets with unknown stains. I wil probably stay there again, but i will bring my own linen.

Reviews.Title: “misleading and trick you when you want to cancel you booking.”
Reviews.Author: haven_inn_sux
Reviews.Content: I wont recommend this hotel to anyone. When you go to their website it is all clean and has all the facilities but when we actually arrive there it was filthy and the swimming pool was empty and very dirty. Beware. Also they dont give refund even though you let them know 48 hours beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “total deseption”
Reviews.Author: Johno91
Reviews.Content: After seeing the place on the net and then booking our stay, we where more than disapointed when we arrived. What you see on their web site is totally false. I don't know where they got the photos for their web site but it was not at the Haven, if they did I would like to know what happened to the reception and the dinning area next to the pool. As for the room, I have stayed in better rooms at a pub. It is one of the most run down places I have ever had the stayed at. As for the staff it was if they where just there to pass the time of day. I think that the people who run this place should be mad by law to rename it a backpackers retreat or a youth hostel. Next time I stay in Sydney I will pay that bit extra and stay in a place where you don't feel embarresst when you walk out the door.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL WE HAVE EVER STAYED IN - ANYWHERE”
Reviews.Author: pattka
Reviews.Content: There was nothing DELUXE about this hotel at all. This word should not even be mentioned in the description. This hotel was the pits. We arrived early so room was not ready. Was pointed to the public bathroom so that I could get changed. No toilet paper and top of cistern on toilet was missing so had to put hand inside to flush. Once inside room not much better. Glass on bathroom heater/fan/light was missing so could see straight through into the roof. Our room had a balcony. It was filthy and the only thing that could fit on it was the air conditioning unit that was there. No room for chairs. Staff were ok, depending on who you got sitting at reception at the time. Asked for directions to walk to Darling Harbour and was told that you can do it as long as you pick the right streets to go down. No help with the streets though. Website is very misleading. I guess they have to do this to get customers. Lovely picture of restaurant with food laid out which was what I was expecting for breakfast. But got there and there is no restaurant at all. Have to go out of the hotel to eat. Hardly slept at all. First night there a group of people obviously home from a night out stayed outside yelling for hours. Reception is supposedly open 24 hours but this group was not told to quieten down. As for street noise, sounded like the traffic was driving through our room all night. Very loud.

Reviews.Title: “value for money...very helpful staff & management, easy access to the city”
Reviews.Author: stokiecarol
Reviews.Content: In a city that's rated one of the most expensive to stay in in the world, I found The Haven Inn very good value for money. Yes, it looks a little "tired" from the outside however, I found my room to be very clean & tidy with a great view to the city, (from the 3rd floor). It was though, very noisy, which admittedly, I'm not used to, and when I requested a change to another room away from Glebe Point Rd the next morning, I received nothing but help & courtesy as the receptionist juggled the bookings at the fully booked hotel. My luggage was taken care of and so I was able to move to a quieter room. The swimming pool was sparkling, while I was there, though they agreed that they'd had a problem with the pump during January. I requested a table for my balcony which was delivered, cheerfully, in minutes. The beds were comfortable and the sheets crisp. All the free to air tv stations were available, the shower had great pressure and there were complimentary newspapers each morning, along with travel literature & contemporary gig guides. They also give you a voucher for a 10% discount at the cafe across the road and they have free internet. For a double or twin room at under $130 a night in such a great location within Sydney, plus a friendly, helpful team of staff & management, it is truly..... great value for money. It's not The Ritz, but it is inexpensive, homely, helpful and I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not value for money”
Reviews.Author: bryanboy
Reviews.Content: on entering this hotel it was clear from the onset that this would be an experience never to be forgotten.firstly their computer system wasn't operating so this made it difficult to find our booking and when a room was found for the 4 of us it was nothing like the picture on their website.We hade booked a double and 1 single bed and foldaway. after carrying our own heavy suitcases up their stairs the room was no different to formula 1 accomodation (which we have stayed in on previous occasions) our two adult daughters only had bunk beds with no pillows ,no crockery,a tv that only had 1 channel operating,constant noise from within the hotel and from outside the premises and a pool that obviously had not been cleaned for some time and was not as heated as what was stated in the description.the bathroom was a disgrace with unclean shower head and a basin that was screaming out to be cleaned .on the ceiling black mildew stains above the shower were annoying plus the damp musty smell that lingered throughout. It seemed to attract a lot of undesirables with noise being accepted by the management.

Reviews.Title: “good relaxing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kevincri
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy staying at the Haven Inn and have stayed there around 5 or 6 times over the last 18 months as both our kids live around Newtown area, and it is a great base to visit from.Only a 12 min. walk to the Sydney fish markets, a fantastic park is at the end of the street with walks all around Blackwattle Bay and beautiful views of Anzac Bridge and Sydney Harbour Bridge. The hotel has been undergoing renovations over the last couple of months,so occasionally a little bit inconvenient, but it is really looking good now and has a great staff base. We arrived at 11 am and thought we would just ask in case they had a room ready, and the manager arranged for our room to be ready in 1/2 an hour so we wern't inconveniced at all. They have a new meal system now with an arrangement with a cafe over the road where you get a discount voucher for breakfast and lunch if you want it. Good bus services to anywhere in the city,and its all so close that cabs are cheap also. You can park at the hotel or there is plenty of parking in the side street next to the library which is also a good place to relax with a good book or magazine for an hour or so.

Reviews.Title: “Well recommended!”
Reviews.Author: travelchick039
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal location for anyone taking a short break in Sydney. Situated in the suburb of Glebe, it is so easy to get a bus into the CBD from across the street. On our return from the stunning Bondi to Coogee coast walk we were able to get a bus direct from Coogee to Glebe and the bus stops literally outside the hotel!. Some of the rooms have been newly renovated with lovely floorboards which makes the rooms fresher and brighter than the ones with carpet. And the rooms facing the shops across the road have a beautiful view of the city. The pool is a very welcome facility. But a real bonus is the staff. They are very friendly and always willing to have a chat. For someone who wants a well priced, relaxed hotel with good access to public transport for a city break we would definitely recommend it. We had read some bad reviews before we travelled. At first glance from the outside of the hotel on arrival we were a little worried as it seemed a bit tired. But we were not without anything during our stay and it seems that alot of money and effort is being spent for renovations. So all we can say is that we enjoyed it and visually it is being attended too and is getting better. We would definitely stay at The Haven Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “If you just want a clean bed in basic surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Kl27
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean as was the linen. The bathroom was fine and although the room was not large we had enough space to be comfortable. However, if you are planning on spending lots of time in your room I think many people would find the rooms too basic. The rooms lack the modern style and space of other hotel rooms but they have air con. The pool was clean enough to swim in. The main draw back for us was the street noise. I would recommend this hotel to people who want a clean bed but are happy not to pay for or get a stylish hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “One night was enough.. Staff were lovely though”
Reviews.Author: kozzie_Lumps
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night before carrying on our travels. Check in was simple, and had help with our bags. We were right above the pool area, although we didnt hear much noise from it. The room itself wasnt the nicest we had stayed in, and was pretty basic, but it was a base not somewhere we were planning on spending alot of time. The area itself wasnt the nicest, and seems quite rough around the edges. There are shops across the road, and a dominos further up the road. There were computers you could use, which were kept on 24 hours in the dinning room, and they had a wide range of dvds you could choose from to watch in your room. I would describe this hotel more as a hostel and would recommend to travellers looking for something on a budget, but no lacking the service, The staff were really helpful and with it being our first time in sydney we didnt know where anything was, and they helped us with directions and maps.

Reviews.Title: “What a dive!!!! A dirty, run down disgrace.”
Reviews.Author: jodadz
Reviews.Content: After finding our room through the dirty scum hallways, we found someone elses bag hanging over the door handle, draws falling apart, a fist hole in the bathroom door, a musty smell and the most run down, filthy room I have ever seen. The pictures on the website are far from the real deal. With two small children, we immediately turned around and asked for our money back. I still get itchy thinking of the experience. Save your time and your money. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A No Frills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyNel
Reviews.Content: Needed to stay in close to the city for one night so chose this property based solely on price. Had read some very positive reviews and also some very negative ones so went with an open mind and as it was only for one night I wasn't too perturbed about the negative ones. The young guy on reception when we arrived was very pleasant and helpful. Yes, the photos on the website do make it look a bit nicer that what it is, but the location makes up for it as it is an easy walk to a variety of cafes and restaurants. It was an extra $15 to park the car and the car park is very small and is hard to maneouvre in and out of a car space, took a small car so wasn't too bad but a larger vehicle may have some difficulty. I was able to leave the car parked there after we checked out which was much appreciated and also great value as car park costs in and around the city are very expensive. Noise is a problem as it is right on the road with buses going past during the night, council trucks in the early hours of the morning and a few arguments out on the street from people walking past didn't do much to help get a good night's sleep. Our room was also near the pool and so we had a lot of noise from that but I don't really mind the sound of kids having a bit of fun. The pool closed at 9pm and the noise from the pool stopped straight after that. We had a balcony but it is very small and really only good to stand on to get a bit of fresh air. The television had very poor reception so gave up trying to watch anything and went for a walk instead. Stairs may cause a problem for those needing to carry a bit of luggage and perhaps prams etc. All in all, not a bad place for a night's stay but I wouldn't want to base myself there much longer than that. The room was clean as was the bedding and towels and if you're looking for something at the lower end of the price range close to the city and you don't want to spend a lot of money or a lot of time in the hotel itself, then I think it's ideal. The hotel no longer provides breakfast but offers 10% off at a cafe just across the road, which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynwat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Haven Inn with my 11yo daughter for two nights. Having read the reviews I was worried about what would greet us however I prefer to spend my holiday dollars on sightseeing and most other hotels in this price range had similar poor reviews. Had a superior balcony room which was clean and provided the facilites we expected. Had a queen bed and single divan which was perfect for us. The room was musty on entering but cleared quickly when opening the balcony door. Carpet, curtains, bedding and towels were clean. Entry to the foyer and verandahs to the room are dated but clean and swipe key entry to room provides security. Pool water appeared clean but tiles need a good scrub. Pool surrounds look nice and had it been warm enough we would have used, Location is about 20mins via tram and bus to city and there are great take away and restaurants across the road. This hotel is very budget but was clean so was satisfied with our stay. We did not experience noice from other residents even though was full house. Traffic noice is evident early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Worst sleep I've ever had at a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Audnomad
Reviews.Content: Kept awake till 3am by other noisy guests, complained to front desk at 1am and they couldn't have cared less. Swearing, loud music, banging doors, showers and hairdryers running till 2am. This place is a dive, steer clear, pay the extra few dollars and stay in the city as we wish we had done. It was a complete waste of money, the pool is green slime and the so-called renovated rooms are disgraceful. I lay in bed scared as hell by the party animals this hotel seems to condone...my only thanks is that my elderly mother slept through the whole horrible ordeal.

Reviews.Title: “A room without windows??”
Reviews.Author: MuseumsRUS
Reviews.Content: Yep. A room with no windows. I'm quite sure it's illegal! With the room number printed on a piece of paper stuck on the door with Blue Tac. As a plus, the room was quite clean, but wow! No windows?

Reviews.Title: “A DUMP in any mans language”
Reviews.Author: DisappointedNov10
Reviews.Content: The advertising qualities of this hotel border on fraud. We left in disgust without even opening our suitcases !

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuy49
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights - the photos are deceptive and the place is pretty run down. The pool is not heated and hence pretty much not useable. The staff, however, do what they can and are pretty helpful. The location is good - nice cafes and restaurants within an easy walk (great Italian opposite, just east of the pub, and great new Thai back towards the city about 400 yards). The 431 and 433 buses get you to Chinatown and the city in 15-20 minutes. We ebjoyed our stay, but next time I would pay some more and stay somewhere a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “ideal place for a budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: bulumumbai
Reviews.Content: amazingly helpful person who manages the reception . but for him , we would have been lost in our trip . he guided us in every bit of plan of seeing "must see" places . train routes , bus routes , ferry trips etc etc -- we are a regular traveler but this 3 days of Sydney was probably best utilized for time This man made up for all the small missing things of the hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Noisey.”
Reviews.Author: Ebco
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly staff and a lot of traffic and guest noise.Apart from that its handy to transport.If your just after a party place it could suit.

Reviews.Title: “Just GOOD things to say about it...”
Reviews.Author: maralia
Reviews.Content: Great service, good breakfast, a lot of cleanness and affection, the staff always helped me when i need, amazing localization...itÂ´s really an HE(a)VEN... Definitively i will come back...

Reviews.Title: “Good basic accommodation and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: GraceT075
Reviews.Content: Knew when booked that it was budget accommodation (couldn't get anywhere else as school holidays), but was pleasantly surprised. The triple bed room wasn't huge, but beds were comfy, bathroom fine, had tea and coffee and flatscreen tv. The staff were extremely helpful and cheery (even lugging up 3 flights our heavy luggage that the airline had lost for 2 days). Shame we couldn't make use of the swimming pool due to the cold and rain. Couple of points - there isn't a lift and 3 floors; if have a room overlooking road although windows have double glazing, the balcony door hasn't so can be noisy. Daughter was pleased had payable internet near breakfast room and a dvd collection could borrow from.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Shidoran
Reviews.Content: I had booked a deal through wotif.com before I read the reviews. So we went along and stayed anyway, we weren't quite sure what to expect. What we did get was a comfortable room that was value for money in a great location with friendly staff. The Hotel & Room: The photos ARE of the hotel, but obviously they are staged and glamourized - most hotels do that, so not sure what the fuss is all about. The pool was heated and ready to go but we weren't too keen on swimming in the colder weather. We had an average looking room obviously refurbished and had no issues with any of the amenities (except the pillows, you definately want to bring your own). Didn't see any cockroaches.... Overall, the place ain't nothing special but it does the job. If you want something fantastic then spend your fantastic money and stop complaining. Location: You just can't top it. Several kms from the city we had the "bridge views" so they are not fantasy! I'm amazed at all the people whinging about it being noisy - it's in GLEBE people, learn to use google maps. This AINT out in the suburbs somewhere, you're talking a busy inner-city area... what do you expect? If you are sensitive to early morning traffic this isn't the place to go, but if you want to stay in a great area close to the city then this definately is worth a look. Parking: Limited spots so get in early or make other arrangements. Only a short walk from the train station though. Wasn't very happy to pay $15 extra for parking - thought that was a rip, so rethink this one if you can. End of the day, for what I paid, the room was not too bad. We got a good sleep, had good amenities at our disposal and the location was great. You can always find things to whinge about nomatter what hotel/motel but we generally enjoyed our stay. I wouldn't be there for long periods of time and if I had paid more I probably wouldn't be as satisfied. Do your research and plan accordingly. You pay less, you get less. General principle of life.

Reviews.Title: “deceiving ...no way again”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneDiana
Reviews.Content: stayed here for couple of nights..thought wed give it a try ourselves and ignore the reviews... sounded great as advertised... famous bridge and city views from balcony.. located in fashionable glebe..poolside buffet breakfast. no poolside and was in room at back of hotel reception somewhere... pool was a dirty green looking thing.. . etc etc etc...we got a superior balcony view suite .. yeah right. we are not hard to please or not that picky ..just dont like being lied to..the photos i upload will explain it all from what they advertised to what we got... once we lowered our standards we stayed for two nights .. did i mention the first thing we did was buy air freshner... and used the can as we were walking upstairs to our room and in the room everyday.. the bed linen looked like you didnt want to touch it ..had it been washed.. ???? the bathroom tap was just holding on.. or should i say falling off.... and watch out when you open the bar fridge.. you get covered in water... was cleaner than the swimming pool though... noisy dirty area and street..

Reviews.Title: “great location but rundown inside and out!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsd1971
Reviews.Content: photo's are very deceptive, the outside is very rundown, the guys were very helpful asking us if we wanted our car parked for us, but my hubby manage to do it..car spaces are very tight!! when we climbed the what felt like 100 stairs and went into our room we were very disappointed!! room was not spotless, decor was outdated , no globes in the bedside lamps tap in bathroom was broken so was the toilet seat...airconditioner didnt feel like it was working, but that could be cos they were very dirty, windows were very dirty and out on the very small balc was a old dirty ripped chair, so we complained and was moved 2 rooms down and this room was not much better out of 5 downlights only 2 worked aircon was no better then the last one and very dirty outside of the cupard and fridge were not cleaned very good..showers need the seals replaced as they spray everywhere... there were no extra pillows and the balc on this one was worse then the other one, this one had a water leak from a drain!!! you had to use the chain latch to close the door as there was no handle...after being moved from the 1st room they tried to then put my sister inlaw in it when they turned up...i have to say i would never go there again nor would i recommend it to my friends. would rather pay extra $50+ to stay somewhere nicer..AND ITS ADVERTISED AS NEW FLATSCREEN TVS...WELL DIDNT SEE ANY OF THEM!!!!!!...and last but not least the pool was very cloudy, so we didnt swim in it...

Reviews.Title: “Best value and location”
Reviews.Author: scottystef
Reviews.Content: Ask for a fresh room, they are upgrading. We stayed with our extended family and all got comparable rooms. Ok there was the occasional mark, the corners and halls register the use in the place, but as a centra lsydney base we would use again and agian. Kids loved the pool, we loved the bus routes and THE PRICE. Glebe is cool, fish market awesome, and rooms friendly and functional. What else did we need? Working AC? Check (was 41deg). Flat screen TV.. Check. Friendly staff.. Check.. Hot showers and clean bathrooms... check. Have stayed in budget hotels before, and this is up there. GO FOR IT.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Kyliejohns
Reviews.Content: though we stayed only for one night with four little chidren, this hotel was so smelly and you can see cockroches near the fridge and in the cups and beds was so smelly and noise everywhere. In the shower taps had current, we don't wanted to touch anything just convienced ourselves only one night, We will not recommend anyone this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “will go back again and again”
Reviews.Author: gazzarose
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on here and was terrified i was booked into the worst hotel in Sydney, but it was too late to change it. We spent 4 nights there and we were totally thrilled with the service, the room and our stay in general. Yes it can be a tad noisy in the morning, but gee yr on a main road, so thats gonna be a given. The rooms are basic, but so are the rates they charge. The rooms are clean and tidy and with all that you will need. The service of the staff is infallable. They were there whenever we needed them and answered all the questions we had. The area Glebe is a great place to stay, right on the bus line to the city and with so many eateries at hand. For the price you pay this place is great, it was my 1st holiday in a hotel and i was very pleased. Only thing i would warn against is that if your elderly or injured the stairs could be a problem. There is no lift and we were on the 3rd floor, that didnt bother us, but could be an issue for others. Thank you Haven Inn for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “In no way Boutique!!! Horrid horrid horrid!!”
Reviews.Author: MdeSoulis
Reviews.Content: Sorry to say this... wish I could say something nice - but the room absolutely reeked of ancient cigarette smoke... made me feel sick - on asking for a clean room was just told all rooms are non smoking - and on asking for a spray was given an old Lynx spray someone had left - hardly better than the smell of smoke... clothes smelt of smoke, felt as tho I was steeped in it... the decor everywhere reminded me of a public loo... definitely NOT of Boutique standard in any way imaginable. The entrance is scruffy, signs broken outside, door needs a paint... and can only be described as serviceable - stairs reminded me of a public car park... tiles like loos on floors and walls - a few pics and lots of leaflets available tho and chap in reception pleasant and tried to be helpful ... ghastly breakfast room reminded me of an ancient school... bit downtrodden shops and restaurants outside [but a great Vietnamese restaurant opposite and a good pub/bar nearby], dark street and felt rather unsafe alone at night... whole place just needs a bit of an upgrade ...

Reviews.Title: “rude management”
Reviews.Author: melbri88
Reviews.Content: the room we booked said for 3 adults. children 18 & under free. complimentary cot. they charged us $25 for the "rollaway bed" which we call a "Cot" apparently in Australia they think 18 year olds should be able to sleep in bed with one of the 3 adults and that a cot is actually a crib to them. i don't know of many 18 yo's that are small enough to sleep in a crib. when i questioned them and told them they provided false advertising the manager was quite arrogant and rude and told me "GOOD LUCK" when I said I was going to complain. They have a new tv but no cable so you have a choice of 5 channels. the bathroom "Redone" consisted of faulty workmanship and a moldy shower. the toilet seat slid around and the balcony had nothing to sit on except an airconditioner to view the "harbour" that consisted of the store fronts across the street. There breakfast is a $15 continental breakfast that we usually get for free in the US at most hotels. it was cheaper to eat at the cafes across the street with a better atmosphere and more personable people. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “nothing like the photos”
Reviews.Author: Daniel88
Reviews.Content: The photos look nothing like the hotel. On the front of the hotel they also suggest that you can see the harbour but you would have to stand on the roof. There is no lift but they will help you with you cases I would not recommend anyone that has problems climbing up stairs or the disabled or elderly. The rooms are a bit tired looking not new as the photos would suggest. but look clean. I unfortuantley turned on the lights in the middle of the night lots of cockroaches running every where. The location is fantastic the buses run every 10 minutes just out the front but even better its on the rail line just 5 minutes walk from the hotel but once again a very steep climb back up as the road is all most vertical you could not manage it with high heels. Elderly or in a wheel chair would be to dangerous to atempt either way. The only thing that kept us there was the great restraunts across the road and the boutique pub great food and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Haven? Only if you are hard of hearing.”
Reviews.Author: Scouse73
Reviews.Content: We booked in for 2 nights including Valentines Night. Not exactly the most romantic setting. (luckily we had a fantastic day/evening in the city!!). The hotel is on a very busy road & we had the worst 2 nights sleep of our entire trip. The aircon (if you can call it that) was just as bad. If the rooms have just been re-vamped then I dread to think what they were like before. We didn't mind the walk to the Harbour or city (the tram is good too) but this hotel is not as central as it tries to make out. Certainly not 1k to Darling Harbour. Glebe itself is great. Lots of restaurants. You won't starve. Don't bother booking in for breakfast. There are far better cafes nearby where you can watch the world go by. Won't be going back. Would rather pay the extra and get a good nights sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “The Homeless Inn”
Reviews.Author: australiaGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from the internet and the pictures that were showing on the internet for this hotel do not look anything like the filthy hotel. I was suppose to be staying there for 3 nights with my husband, mum and daughter but checked out after the first night it was that bad. I have stayed in alot of basic accommodation all over the world and also in Australia but have never had anything as bad as this. We had booked a deluxe room with superior balcony to sleep four. There was nothing deluxe about the room and the balcony was certainly not superior. The room was that small you could not swing a cat in it. The bedding was filthy and was smelly. The furniture in the room was broken and outdated, the bathroom was filthy and the window had no glass at top and it felt like you were sleeping in Sauchiehall Street in Glasgow the noise was that bad. It stated on internet swimming pool opening hour 7am- 10pm but after 6pm it was so dark you could not swim and there was no lights. There was a sign on our landing pointing to the oasis bar but apparently there has been no bar for 10 years one of many lies i found. It also states on internet 1km from Darling Harbour this is another lie it is not 1km I would say nearer 2- 21/12km. They also have a picture of the rooms down the front of the hotel building showing lovely rooms, I think this was taken in another hotel as it looked nothing like the rooms in the hotel. After speaking to the manager the next morning i questioned him about the rooms and other facilities it was stating on internet. He was not the least bit intersted so we checked out and found ourselves a lovely hotel right down near the harbour and was 50 dollars cheaper. People be aware if considering this hotel as it looks nothing like the pictures on the internet and is dirty. We were not the only ones complaining that day another family had just checked in and were already asking reception if they could shorten their stay as it was that bad.

Reviews.Title: “the bates motel”
Reviews.Author: alan07Leith
Reviews.Content: After being dropped off outside this hotel our hearts sunk when we seen the outside and the welcome from the unfriendly receptionists epitomised our stay.the rooms were a disgrace and not fit to stay in.we complained straight away and wanted our money back to no avail.we were then offered "better" rooms which were a bit better.area was great though just a shame and def no a boutique hotel

Reviews.Title: “It may not have been the perfect haven, but its what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: jayjay5407
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Sydney for 3 days in September this year. We were looking for a hotel that was well priced and gave us value for our money. Luckily we spotted The Haven Inn on the internet. To be frank, it was not the best hotel we have stayed at, but it did surpass our expectations. The staff were very friendly, breakfast was good value and rooms were kept tidy. We were also surprised by the location and the amount of different types of restraunts in the area. At first we thought getting around the city would be difficult, but it was a breeze with buses and the tram pretty much at the door step. I would definately recommend to people looking to stay in the city for value and service, but dont expect 5 star luxuries.

Reviews.Title: “greas little place”
Reviews.Author: LuffyChristchurch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Haven Inn for four nights and had a great time.. Location is superb, My two biggies are a comfy bed and an excellent shower.. This had both and was clean and tidy.. It is not posh, but you are not paying posh either.. Location was the absolute best. so many restuarants and deli's, down the most interesting road in Sydney. The young ladies and gentlemen on the front desk were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Horror Inn”
Reviews.Author: Larny
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful. The description did not match the hotel at all. We requested a non-smoking room and it stank of smoke. The bathroom was full of mildew and the balcony was so dusty I could write my name in the dust. I had to carry my suitcase up three flights of stairs. There was no offer to have them taken up and there is no elevator. The breakfast was bad too. The bread and pastries were stale and the cereal was kept in containers that looked like they were from the 60's and had just been repeatedly filled without washing. Don't stay here

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zanderch
Reviews.Content: This is clearly a budget hotel ,so would not reccommend paying a high price for any room.The bathrooms had been renovated and for myself who had a hire car and was not there alot during the day it served my needs.Would I stay there again ,no.But it had a satisfactory breakfast,,clean sheets, I slept well because I was tired,and there are many worse places for the a higher price. There are times in your life where you need a budget motel and this serves that need. But I warn anyone who books to ask for a first floor room as lugging a suitcase up three flights of stairs ,is a tedious exercise and also, when something goes wrong ,as did my credit card type key ,which did not work twice, my fault as I put it near my mobile phone apparently, I had to go down to the desk and then up again once it was re keyed. and then go back down again,good exercise I suppose. I am 52 so anyone contemplating staying there or anyone who is eldrly should reconsider staying here, because anything that involved an emergency would make it very difficult to get out in a rush, without an elevator. There is assistance to help with luggage, and I could definately have asked for that and should have done this..Balcony ,no room to swing a cat or sit on dirty chair, and little view of anything. Video would not work for my free DVD and as I rang the guy at the desk telling him about the problem, he came up immediatley and showed me how to get it working, and this impressed me. There are times in your life where you want a budget motel and this served my needs and the cost was very reasonable, considering many of the other hotels were either too expensive or booked out. If I was young and energetic I would stay there again.Staff did not say much or greet you each morning but it was only a relative type stay , so iIwasnot sightseeing and it served my needs. There was also an opportunity to take a walk and see some average Sydney homes and this in itself was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, avoid, avoid !!”
Reviews.Author: dangermouse123
Reviews.Content: One word summary of this place - NOISY. The hotel is well-placed for public transport - the buses feel like they're right in your room. Glebe is not a bad area, but this hotel has little to recommend it. The hotel website seems to have taken creative photography to new heights, as our 'superior' balcony room looked nothing like the pictures - the couch was falling apart, the furniture was basic and worn, and there were bare wires hanging down above the shower head, where the bathroom renovations hadn't been finished. We asked for a different room, but none was available, we asked for a replacement DVD player because the one in the room was broken, but got a 'there's nothing I can do' response from reception - this seems to be their standard response as we also heard it when asking them to book an airport bus for us after 9pm. Spend your money elsewhere, even if it means paying a few extra dollars - at least you might get a decent night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Poor location, but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: UncleMikeUk
Reviews.Content: First off, be warned. The outside of the hotel is ghastly. Even in the 1970s, this would've looked out of date. You then get to reception, and one whole wall has been replaced with clear glass showing, errr, a car park. It's as though there are cars waiting to check-in or something... But, for the $109 AUS I paid for my double-room with a balcony, it's not bad from there on. A large bed, a single bed next to it, TV & DVD player, good air-con, fridge, iron, large bathroom (walk-in shower). The reception has a large selection of DVDs for you to borrow (no charge). And yes, there is quite a small but nice outdoor pool. And the reception staff are really friendly. Full marks there. All in all, it's not a bad hotel, as long as you close your eyes as you walk in.. but the location is truly terrible. You're 30 minutes (2 miles) walk from Central Station, 2 miles walk from Darling Harbour. There ARE bars and shops near the hotel, but very little else. Personally, I would opt for a hotel in a better location - there are plenty of quiet, similarly-priced hotels closer to Central Station, and all will then allow you to walk to Darling Harbour, the shopping precincts, and so on. Having to get buses & taxis to get to civilization did nothing for me!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: pachufus
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the negative comments about this place - the room was so dusty, it made me ill. All they needed to do was sweep the floor as it is laminate! Noisy isn't the word, if its not the other residents, its the locals. Breakfast isn't worth getting up for. Get up early if you want a hot shower. The only thing going for this place is it is in a good place, Glebe Point Road is famous for its inexpensive restaurants, and the bus journey into the city centre is only 20 mins. This place is only a tiny bit better than a hostel... We would have moved if it wasn't for Kylie, U2, the Ashes and a couple of cruise ships - all other hotels were fully booked, and believe me we spent hours phoning round trying to find somewhere wlse to stay!

Reviews.Title: “What a bad experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dirty rooms, very noisy we were unable to sleep due to traffic and noise from the other rooms also doors banging allnight. Breakfast was not worth the money, just a bit of cereal nothing else. Bathroom was very small. You could not sit out on the balcony due to the traffic noise and polution. If i were you i would not stay at this hotel. It is also along way from the centre of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “What a awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I strongly advise anyone staying at this hotel. The rooms are dirty , there is no double glazing so the noise from the road outside is terrible, we were unable to sleep as the buses were up and down the road all night. Breakfast is very stingy. All in all a bad experience

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: dave_zero
Reviews.Content: Room 304. Mid - March 2006. Superior spa room. Cost on wotif - $140/nite. When the Legion cab bearing yours truly pulled up at the Haven, I frankly didn't know what to expect. The reviews I'd read of the place conflicted wildly and I hadn't set foot in trendy Glebe since Star Wars was on at the Valhalla. So I'd come prepared for anything. OK. First impressions. The Haven isn't going to win any prizes for architecture. I'm tipping that the rash of heritage orders in this area didn't get going til well after the Haven was already up. With its off-white brick exterior and early 70's decor, it's not a particularly attractive building from the outside. If you're looking to take in the Victorian ambience of Glebe's streetscapes, I suggest you take a walk down Glebe Point Rd with the Haven behind you at all times. 1/5 for external appearance. Once inside though, the place doesn't seem too bad. The girl on reception's friendly, efficient and helpful. There's no waiting to be checked in and no leave-a-credit-card-or-$100-cash-to-cover-your-mini-bar-rorting formalities either. Guess that's cause there's no mini-bar. There's no lift either and I'm on the top floor, but the offers of assistance with the bags are coming thick and fast. On top of all that, I can get free DVD for the night, so happy days. 5/5 for check in. Up the stairs and into my room and it's cold (YES!!!) there's air conditioning and it works a treat. Despite the sub-tropical Sydney funk of the day outside, I have to turn it down in the end because it's just too efficient. 5/5 for air conditioning. The room's reasonably sized and clean enough, but the balcony is quite small and spartan and at no time during my stay do I get motivated to venture out there. The room decor's like you used to see in country motels - in fact the whole place reminds me of the Flag Inn at Holbrook circa 1988. It's clean and it's comfortable. It's not 5 star. There's a small fridge with tea and coffee making facilities and an iron and board as well. 3/5 for the room. The bathroom is OK, but quite overwhelmed by the spa with shower over. The sink is also pretty small and awkwardly located under a shelf, causing me to headbutt the shelf when I was brushing my teeth. 3/5 for the bathroom. Across the road is the Toxteth Hotel - a fine drinking establishment even if the punters DON'T like my jukebox selections. What's wrong with some people anyway? The Ramones are SEMINAL, man. Glebe Point Rd is littered with eating establishments so you won't go hungry, ever. It also boasts the highest proportion of Tarot reading places per square mile in the southern hemishere. 5/5 for local activity. Night time. Noise. Oh deary me. How's the serenity? Well there isn't any. Glebe Point Rd has a surprisingly high volume of traffic late at night. The double-glazing mentioned in an earlier review was not in evidence and this is no place for the light sleeper. 0/5 for serenity. Brekky. The price is right at $5, but don't expect a wide selection. A bit of fruit to go with the cereal would've been appreciated. 2/5 for breakfast. Overall I'd recommend the Haven for budget travellers and those with powerful sleeping drugs or narcolepsy. For $140/nite, I've found better places in the city on wotif in the past. The Haven staff are quite good but the building is a bit dated and could use some maintenance. Glebe's a fun area and close to the city too, but next time I think I'll try somewhere new.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got a really good rate from the Internet which meant this was a great deal. I stayed for 4 nights and had no complaints. The stairs could be a problem for some people but the helpful reception staff carried my bags up and down for me, and even offered to carry me if needed! The location is a nice local subarb and there is lots of transport into the city on the buses. Don't stay here if you want to be right in the heart of Sydney, to walk to the centre could be 20-30 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 month vacation in Australia and our last 5 days were spent at the Haven Inn. We had tried 3 other Sydney hotels in the similar price range as we were using Sydney as a base whilst we travelled up and down the coast and inland. The Haven Inn was by far the most comfortable and best located and in fact the only spotlessly clean hotel we stayed at not only in Sydney but all around Australia. Our room had new carpet ,new bed , new tv and dvd,safe, a balcony ovelooking the city and double glazed windows so it wasnt noisy at all. I would also like to thank all the staff at the hotel who made our last days in Australia so happy.Special mention to Tracey who on our last day organised a suprise dinner for my wife at the Boathouse restaurant right near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, poor for *** grade”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very plain and definitely not worth the internet discount rate of USD100 per night, let alone the standard rate of USD175 per night. I feel that AUD80 per night is a more "value" price. There is no elevator, the outside walls are not maintained. Rooms do not filter outside noise. I'm curious to know who awarded the *** rating and when!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: tbbaker
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, and stayed a few nights here. We really enjoyed the place. It's close to town, and in a funky area with interesting shops. The staff were excellent, and very friendly. There is a lot of street noise, but it didn't stop us sleeping. For us, it was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff was generally helpful. However, windows were drafty and street noise especially from buses was loud. Phone cord kept coming out from receiver. $5 breakfast was inadequate as pastries were not replenished and only hot food was toast. Water pressure from shower was low. Soap but no shampoo was provided. One of drawers in dresser was actually missing. Since there were no elevators, we had to drag our luggage up the stairs. There were no in-room safes. Furnishings seemed old. On the positive side, the location was quite convenient. This was a nice neighbourhood with plenty of moms pushing baby carriages, a library, groceries, restaurants, fruit market and internet cafe across the street. It was a short ride to Sydney attractions by cab or bus. We were able to borrow one DVD without charge and we also received a free bottle of wine as part of an Internet special.

Reviews.Title: “Our Haven in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Haven and loved it. The room had been completely refurbished and we were very impressed with the dvd and cd player, with loads of movies available at reception for free! The location was excellent with buses outside and trams just a 2 minute walk away. A perfect base to explore Sydney and the staff were so friendly and helpful. This is a very comfortable hotel to base yourself in Sydney whilst you are doing all the sights.And dont forget your bathers cause the pool was heated to about 30 degrees when we were there! And last but not least my major weakness , especially when on holidays, is eating and their was an extravaganza of choice up and down Glebe Point Road!

HotelInfo.Name: The Haven Inn Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 196 Glebe Point Rd | Glebe, Sydney, New South Wales 2037, Australia
